<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsTcpRawArgs-name">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsTcpRaw.ts#L255">property <b>name</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>name?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The input port which receives raw data.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsTcpRawArgs-queue">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsTcpRaw.ts#L262">property <b>queue</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>queue?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Valid values: (parsingQueue | indexQueue)
Specifies where the input processor should deposit the events it reads. Defaults to parsingQueue.
Set queue to parsingQueue to apply props.conf and other parsing rules to your data. For more information about props.conf and rules for timestamping and linebreaking, refer to props.conf and the online documentation at "Monitor files and directories with inputs.conf"
Set queue to indexQueue to send your data directly into the index.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsTcpRawArgs-rawTcpDoneTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsTcpRaw.ts#L267">property <b>rawTcpDoneTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>rawTcpDoneTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies in seconds the timeout value for adding a Done-key. Default value is 10 seconds.
If a connection over the port specified by name remains idle after receiving data for specified number of seconds, it adds a Done-key. This implies the last event is completely received.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsTcpRawArgs-restrictToHost">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsTcpRaw.ts#L271">property <b>restrictToHost</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>restrictToHost?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Allows for restricting this input to only accept data from the host specified here.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsTcpRawArgs-source">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsTcpRaw.ts#L276">property <b>source</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>source?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Sets the source key/field for events from this input. Defaults to the input file path.
Sets the source key initial value. The key is used during parsing/indexing, in particular to set the source field during indexing. It is also the source field used at search time. As a convenience, the chosen string is prepended with 'source::'.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsTcpRawArgs-sourcetype">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsTcpRaw.ts#L282">property <b>sourcetype</b></a>

Set the source type for events from this input.
"sourcetype=" is automatically prepended to <string>.
Defaults to audittrail (if signedaudit=true) or fschange (if signedaudit=false).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpArgs-acl">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsUdp.ts#L227">property <b>acl</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>acl?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/splunk/types/input/#InputsUdpAcl'>InputsUdpAcl</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

The app/user context that is the namespace for the resource

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpArgs-connectionHost">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsUdp.ts#L236">property <b>connectionHost</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>connectionHost?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Valid values: (ip | dns | none)
Set the host for the remote server that is sending data.
ip sets the host to the IP address of the remote server sending data.
dns sets the host to the reverse DNS entry for the IP address of the remote server sending data.
none leaves the host as specified in inputs.conf, which is typically the Splunk system hostname.
Default value is dns.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpArgs-disabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsUdp.ts#L240">property <b>disabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>disabled?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Indicates if input is disabled.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpArgs-host">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsUdp.ts#L244">property <b>host</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>host?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The value to populate in the host field for incoming events. This is used during parsing/indexing, in particular to set the host field. It is also the host field used at search time.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpArgs-index">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsUdp.ts#L248">property <b>index</b></a>

Which index events from this input should be stored in. Defaults to default.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpArgs-noAppendingTimestamp">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpArgs-noPriorityStripping">

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>noPriorityStripping?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpArgs-queue">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpArgs-restrictToHost">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsUdp.ts#L269">property <b>restrictToHost</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>restrictToHost?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Restrict incoming connections on this port to the host specified here.
If this is not set, the value specified in [udp://<remote server>:<port>] in inputs.conf is used.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpArgs-source">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsUdp.ts#L273">property <b>source</b></a>

The value to populate in the source field for incoming events. The same source should not be used for multiple data inputs.

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>queue?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Which queue events from this input should be sent to. Generally this does not need to be changed.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpState-restrictToHost">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsUdp.ts#L209">property <b>restrictToHost</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>restrictToHost?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Restrict incoming connections on this port to the host specified here.
If this is not set, the value specified in [udp://<remote server>:<port>] in inputs.conf is used.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpState-source">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsUdp.ts#L213">property <b>source</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>source?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The value to populate in the source field for incoming events. The same source should not be used for multiple data inputs.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="InputsUdpState-sourcetype">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/inputsUdp.ts#L217">property <b>sourcetype</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>sourcetype?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The value to populate in the sourcetype field for incoming events.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="OutputsTcpDefaultArgs" data-link-title="OutputsTcpDefaultArgs">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpDefault.ts#L207">
        interface <strong>OutputsTcpDefaultArgs</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>OutputsTcpDefaultArgs</span></code></pre>

The set of arguments for constructing a OutputsTcpDefault resource.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpDefaultArgs-acl">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpDefault.ts#L211">property <b>acl</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>acl?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/splunk/types/input/#OutputsTcpDefaultAcl'>OutputsTcpDefaultAcl</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

The app/user context that is the namespace for the resource

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpDefaultArgs-defaultGroup">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpDefault.ts#L216">property <b>defaultGroup</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>defaultGroup?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Comma-separated list of one or more target group names, specified later in [tcpout:<target_group>] stanzas of outputs.conf.spec file.
The forwarder sends all data to the specified groups. If you do not want to forward data automatically, do not set this attribute. Can be overridden by an inputs.conf _TCP_ROUTING setting, which in turn can be overridden by a props.conf/transforms.conf modifier.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpDefaultArgs-disabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpDefault.ts#L220">property <b>disabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>disabled?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Disables default tcpout settings

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpDefaultArgs-dropEventsOnQueueFull">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpDefault.ts#L227">property <b>dropEventsOnQueueFull</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>dropEventsOnQueueFull?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If set to a positive number, wait the specified number of seconds before throwing out all new events until the output queue has space. Defaults to -1 (do not drop events).
<br>CAUTION: Do not set this value to a positive integer if you are monitoring files.
Setting this to -1 or 0 causes the output queue to block when it gets full, which causes further blocking up the processing chain. If any target group queue is blocked, no more data reaches any other target group.
Using auto load-balancing is the best way to minimize this condition, because, in that case, multiple receivers must be down (or jammed up) before queue blocking can occur.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpDefaultArgs-heartbeatFrequency">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpDefault.ts#L232">property <b>heartbeatFrequency</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>heartbeatFrequency?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

How often (in seconds) to send a heartbeat packet to the receiving server.
Heartbeats are only sent if sendCookedData=true. Defaults to 30 seconds.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpDefaultArgs-indexAndForward">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpDefault.ts#L237">property <b>indexAndForward</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>indexAndForward?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies whether to index all data locally, in addition to forwarding it. Defaults to false.
This is known as an "index-and-forward" configuration. This attribute is only available for heavy forwarders. It is available only at the top level [tcpout] stanza in outputs.conf. It cannot be overridden in a target group.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpDefaultArgs-maxQueueSize">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpDefault.ts#L246">property <b>maxQueueSize</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maxQueueSize?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specify an integer or integer[KB|MB|GB].
<br>Sets the maximum size of the forwarder output queue. It also sets the maximum size of the wait queue to 3x this value, if you have enabled indexer acknowledgment (useACK=true).
Although the wait queue and the output queues are both configured by this attribute, they are separate queues. The setting determines the maximum size of the queue in-memory (RAM) buffer.
For heavy forwarders sending parsed data, maxQueueSize is the maximum number of events. Since events are typically much shorter than data blocks, the memory consumed by the queue on a parsing forwarder is likely to be much smaller than on a non-parsing forwarder, if you use this version of the setting.
If specified as a lone integer (for example, maxQueueSize=100), maxQueueSize indicates the maximum number of queued events (for parsed data) or blocks of data (for unparsed data). A block of data is approximately 64KB. For non-parsing forwarders, such as universal forwarders, that send unparsed data, maxQueueSize is the maximum number of data blocks.
If specified as an integer followed by KB, MB, or GB (for example, maxQueueSize=100MB), maxQueueSize indicates the maximum RAM allocated to the queue buffer. Defaults to 500KB (which means a maximum size of 500KB for the output queue and 1500KB for the wait queue, if any).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpDefaultArgs-name">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpDefault.ts#L250">property <b>name</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>name?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Configuration to be edited. The only valid value is "tcpout".

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpDefaultArgs-sendCookedData">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpDefault.ts#L255">property <b>sendCookedData</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>sendCookedData?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If true, events are cooked (processed by Splunk software). If false, events are raw and untouched prior to sending. Defaults to true.
Set to false if you are sending to a third-party system.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpGroupArgs-dropEventsOnQueueFull">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpGroup.ts#L247">property <b>dropEventsOnQueueFull</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>dropEventsOnQueueFull?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If set to a positive number, wait the specified number of seconds before throwing out all new events until the output queue has space. Defaults to -1 (do not drop events).
<br>CAUTION: Do not set this value to a positive integer if you are monitoring files.
Setting this to -1 or 0 causes the output queue to block when it gets full, which causes further blocking up the processing chain. If any target group queue is blocked, no more data reaches any other target group.
Using auto load-balancing is the best way to minimize this condition, because, in that case, multiple receivers must be down (or jammed up) before queue blocking can occur.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpGroupArgs-heartbeatFrequency">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpGroup.ts#L252">property <b>heartbeatFrequency</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>heartbeatFrequency?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

How often (in seconds) to send a heartbeat packet to the receiving server.
Heartbeats are only sent if sendCookedData=true. Defaults to 30 seconds.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpGroupArgs-maxQueueSize">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpGroup.ts#L261">property <b>maxQueueSize</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maxQueueSize?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specify an integer or integer[KB|MB|GB].
<br>Sets the maximum size of the forwarder output queue. It also sets the maximum size of the wait queue to 3x this value, if you have enabled indexer acknowledgment (useACK=true).
Although the wait queue and the output queues are both configured by this attribute, they are separate queues. The setting determines the maximum size of the queue in-memory (RAM) buffer.
For heavy forwarders sending parsed data, maxQueueSize is the maximum number of events. Since events are typically much shorter than data blocks, the memory consumed by the queue on a parsing forwarder is likely to be much smaller than on a non-parsing forwarder, if you use this version of the setting.
If specified as a lone integer (for example, maxQueueSize=100), maxQueueSize indicates the maximum number of queued events (for parsed data) or blocks of data (for unparsed data). A block of data is approximately 64KB. For non-parsing forwarders, such as universal forwarders, that send unparsed data, maxQueueSize is the maximum number of data blocks.
If specified as an integer followed by KB, MB, or GB (for example, maxQueueSize=100MB), maxQueueSize indicates the maximum RAM allocated to the queue buffer. Defaults to 500KB (which means a maximum size of 500KB for the output queue and 1500KB for the wait queue, if any).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpGroupArgs-method">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpGroup.ts#L265">property <b>method</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>method?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Valid values: (tcpout | syslog). Specifies the type of output processor.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpGroupArgs-name">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpGroup.ts#L269">property <b>name</b></a>

The name of the group of receivers.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpGroupArgs-sendCookedData">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpGroup.ts#L274">property <b>sendCookedData</b></a>

If true, events are cooked (processed by Splunk software). If false, events are raw and untouched prior to sending. Defaults to true.
Set to false if you are sending to a third-party system.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpGroupArgs-servers">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpGroup.ts#L278">property <b>servers</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>servers: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Comma-separated list of servers to include in the group.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpGroupState-dropEventsOnQueueFull">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpGroup.ts#L187">property <b>dropEventsOnQueueFull</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>dropEventsOnQueueFull?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If set to a positive number, wait the specified number of seconds before throwing out all new events until the output queue has space. Defaults to -1 (do not drop events).
<br>CAUTION: Do not set this value to a positive integer if you are monitoring files.
Setting this to -1 or 0 causes the output queue to block when it gets full, which causes further blocking up the processing chain. If any target group queue is blocked, no more data reaches any other target group.
Using auto load-balancing is the best way to minimize this condition, because, in that case, multiple receivers must be down (or jammed up) before queue blocking can occur.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpServerArgs-sslCommonNameToCheck">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpServer.ts#L238">property <b>sslCommonNameToCheck</b></a>

Check the common name of the server's certificate against this name.
If there is no match, assume that Splunk Enterprise is not authenticated against this server. You must specify this setting if sslVerifyServerCert is true.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpServerArgs-sslPassword">

The password associated with the CAcert.
The default Splunk Enterprise CAcert uses the password "password."

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpServerArgs-sslRootCaPath">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpServer.ts#L247">property <b>sslRootCaPath</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>sslRootCaPath?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The path to the root certificate authority file.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpServerState-sslAltNameToCheck">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpServerState-sslCommonNameToCheck">

Check the common name of the server's certificate against this name.
If there is no match, assume that Splunk Enterprise is not authenticated against this server. You must specify this setting if sslVerifyServerCert is true.

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpSyslog.ts#L201">property <b>server</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>server?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

host:port of the server where syslog data should be sent

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpSyslogArgs-syslogSourcetype">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpSyslog.ts#L210">property <b>syslogSourcetype</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>syslogSourcetype?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies a rule for handling data in addition to that provided by the "syslog" sourcetype. By default, there is no value for syslogSourceType.
<br>This string is used as a substring match against the sourcetype key. For example, if the string is set to 'syslog', then all source types containing the string "syslog" receives this special treatment.
To match a source type explicitly, use the pattern "sourcetype::sourcetype_name." For example
syslogSourcetype = sourcetype::apache_common
Data that is "syslog" or matches this setting is assumed to already be in syslog format.
Data that does not match the rules has a header, potentially a timestamp, and a hostname added to the front of the event. This is how Splunk software causes arbitrary log data to match syslog expectations.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpSyslogArgs-timestampFormat">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpSyslog.ts#L215">property <b>timestampFormat</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>timestampFormat?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Format of timestamp to add at start of the events to be forwarded.
The format is a strftime-style timestamp formatting string. See $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/system/README/outputs.conf.spec for details.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpSyslogArgs-type">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/outputsTcpSyslog.ts#L219">property <b>type</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>type?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Protocol to use to send syslog data. Valid values: (tcp | udp ).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="OutputsTcpSyslogState-syslogSourcetype">

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ProviderArgs" data-link-title="ProviderArgs">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/provider.ts#L63">
        interface <strong>ProviderArgs</strong>
    </a>

Space-separated list. Specifies the set (and load order) of CID fonts for handling Simplified Chinese(gb), Traditional Chinese(cns), Japanese(jp), and Korean(kor) in Integrated PDF Rendering.If multiple fonts provide a glyph for a given character code, the glyph from the first font specified in the list is used.To skip loading any CID fonts, specify the empty string.Defaults to 'gb cns jp kor'

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SavedSearchesArgs-autoSummarizeMaxSummaryRatio">

The maximum ratio of summary_size/bucket_size, which specifies when to stop summarization and deem it unhelpful for a bucket. Defaults to 0.1 Note: The test is only performed if the summary size is larger than auto_summarize.max_summary_size.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SavedSearchesArgs-autoSummarizeMaxSummarySize">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SavedSearchesArgs-autoSummarizeTimespan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/savedSearches.ts#L1865">property <b>autoSummarizeTimespan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>autoSummarizeTimespan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The list of time ranges that each summarized chunk should span. This comprises the list of available granularity levels for which summaries would be available. Specify a comma delimited list of time specifiers.For example a timechart over the last month whose granuality is at the day level should set this to 1d. If you need the same data summarized at the hour level for weekly charts, use: 1h,1d.

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>name?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SavedSearchesArgs-realtimeSchedule">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/savedSearches.ts#L1969">property <b>realtimeSchedule</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>realtimeSchedule?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Defaults to 1. Controls the way the scheduler computes the next execution time of a scheduled search. If this value is set to 1, the scheduler bases its determination of the next scheduled search execution time on the current time. If this value is set to 0, the scheduler bases its determination of the next scheduled search on the last search execution time. This is called continuous scheduling. If set to 0, the scheduler never skips scheduled execution periods. However, the execution of the saved search might fall behind depending on the scheduler load. Use continuous scheduling whenever you enable the summary index option.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SavedSearchesArgs-scheduleWindow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/savedSearches.ts#L1993">property <b>scheduleWindow</b></a>

Time window (in minutes) during which the search has lower priority. Defaults to 0. The scheduler can give higher priority to more critical searches during this window. The window must be smaller than the search period.Set to auto to let the scheduler determine the optimal window value automatically. Requires the editSearchScheduleWindow capability to override auto.

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>name?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SavedSearchesState-realtimeSchedule">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/savedSearches.ts#L1435">property <b>realtimeSchedule</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>realtimeSchedule?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Defaults to 1. Controls the way the scheduler computes the next execution time of a scheduled search. If this value is set to 1, the scheduler bases its determination of the next scheduled search execution time on the current time. If this value is set to 0, the scheduler bases its determination of the next scheduled search on the last search execution time. This is called continuous scheduling. If set to 0, the scheduler never skips scheduled execution periods. However, the execution of the saved search might fall behind depending on the scheduler load. Use continuous scheduling whenever you enable the summary index option.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SavedSearchesState-scheduleWindow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-splunk/blob/0f38d8cf474414dda4ca015d9c364aff5b28618a/sdk/nodejs/savedSearches.ts#L1459">property <b>scheduleWindow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>scheduleWindow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Time window (in minutes) during which the search has lower priority. Defaults to 0. The scheduler can give higher priority to more critical searches during this window. The window must be smaller than the search period.Set to auto to let the scheduler determine the optimal window value automatically. Requires the editSearchScheduleWindow capability to override auto.
